Thanks, dude.

I'm pretty sure Azir's soldier attacks are just augmented basic attacks, like a Garen Q. Hence their dependence on his attack speed and his designation as a "Marksman".

Oh yea I know, he would be totally busted if he could just AA away for free in lane xD Im just joking around, cos its kinda annoying. 

But because they apply ability effects (Rylai's, Ludens etc) as opposed to auto attack effects (Sheen, etc) and don't proc Thornmail, I think they are considered to be abilities rather than attacks.

So while it is balanced that he gets minion aggro for them, it doesn't fit in with the logic of how abilities usually work. 

_(I guess it's the same reason why Vayne's silver bolts don't work with Runanns. Game health.)_

Im not complaining! haha it's balanced, it just feels weird xD

Yea good point, the thing about LoL that sneaks past us all is that there are so many "special cases" that sort of pop up over time, not rooted in any preset rules or logic, and we just get used to them. A recent one being that Redemption healing is now triple affected by heal boost effects, purely for balance reasons.

Yea definitely.
It's good to have a consistent system that players can follow, but it would be a crime to have certain kits or items unable to be implemented because of the fine print.
